Subjective: Left ear pain and feeling of water for 2-3 days. Gradually worsening. Associated decreased hearing in left ear. Pain is 3-4/10, increasing to 6-7/10 after showering. Impact: Unable to swim. Social: Recently started swimming; cleans ears with cotton buds 3x/week. Meds: No painkillers taken. Negatives: No fever, feels generally well. Request: Wants pain to stop and to know the cause.
Objective: Temp: 36.2 C. Right Ear: Canal clean, eardrum normal. Left Ear: Pain on pinna traction. External canal is red, swollen, inflamed, and thick. Eardrum not well visualized.
Assessment: Left Otitis Externa (inflamed ear canal), likely secondary to moisture from swimming and trauma from cotton bud use.
Plan: 1. Prescribed acidic, anti-inflammatory ear drops, 3 times daily for one week. 2. Paracetamol up to 4000mg per day as needed for pain. 3. Advice: Keep left ear dry for one week; stop cleaning with cotton buds. 4. Follow-up: Return for consultation in one week.
